question: Question_05_(a)
statement:
If

\begin{align*}F(x) = \int_0^x \ln(2+\sin t)\,dt\end{align*} and

\begin{align*}G(y) = \int_y^0 \ln(2+\sin t)\,dt,\end{align*}

find $\displaystyle F'\left(\frac{\pi}2\right)$ and
$\displaystyle G'\left(\frac{\pi}2\right)$.
hints:
Use a \emph{fundamental} theorem that connects integration and
differentiation.
